title.narrative: Addressing the energy, water, food and climate nexus through organic waste to energy solutions in the Metropolitan Region of Recife

description.narrative: The project is based on an official request of the Government of the State of Pernambuco. It aims to lay the foundation for a larger project to be implemented in partnership with the Government, private sector and with support of international climate finance. The project addresses the sensitive energy, water, food and climate nexus in the Metropolitan Region of Recife (RMR) by promoting the use of organic waste to energy solutions (WTE). The project is of cross-sectoral nature and contributes to the implementation of several federal, state-level and urban policies and regulations, such as the Solid Waste Plan of RMR, the State Plan for Solid Residues of Pernambuco, the Recife Sanitation Plan, the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC), as well as the recently adopted 2050 National Energy Plan with its ambitious renewable energy targets. Solid waste management, water and sanitation, energy security and climate change adaptation are major interrelated concerns of the Metropolitan Region of Pernambuco (RMR), which includes 15 municipalities, provides livelihood for around 4 million people and hosts major industries in the region.
